heading.description: My mission is to build apps that are functionally robust, maintainable, and secure. Our needs evolve, and this should be reflected in the codebase. Software provides freedom through access and automation, and I love the challenge of future-proofing it.

content.description: I am passionate about helping people and I want this represented in the problems I am solving. I strongly believe in principles of sustainability and equality of opportunity, and it is equally important to me that people are not just surviving but thriving. Whether it is working in healthcare or personal development; from mental health to the entertainment industry, I want to be solving problems that are going to bring real benefit to peoples' lives.

heading.description: Whether it is learning a new tech stack, working in a team, or understanding unique and dynamic problems, it is my commitment to architect and build solutions. My experience to-date has been the result of genuine curiosity and interest, if I choose to work for you it means I am invested.

content.description: I have a Bachelor (Honours) degree in Psychology, I want to help people and I find Psychology interesting, though it is not a profession I have decided to pursue. I am now passionate about technology as a way to help others.

Some of the skills I developed at university involve critical thinking, researching, academic writing and literature review, prioritising assignments, meeting deadlines, and understanding evidence-based principles for human motivation.

I was awarded a Letter of Commendation for outstanding academic performance after achieving a grade average above 80%, and wrote a dissertation on psychological well-being, which involved me recruiting and coordinating over 100 participants who volunteered for a week-long data analysis.

Cleaned up navigation flow
- bringing buttons into context
- signing in only when necessary
- removing buttons
- making main service catalogue the home page and removing
- removing extraneous logos with no visual appeal or navigation utility
- conditionally rendered navigation bars, sign in and notification icons depending on login and authentication status
- changed routing
- adding useful error prompts to guide users on validator

Redesigned welcome page
- removed unhelpful buttons
- resized images
- add autoplay carousels
Turned sign in into modal view
Added in browser functionality
Optimised stored procedure queries

Added new feature
- all managers to apply on clients behalf
- creating new query to populate an ionic-* dropdown
- understanding the business logic and query paramaters to modify the authentication and data update flow

Enhanced security
- implemented access and refresh token best practices
- implemented auth service utility for backend connected authentication checks
- implemented secure storage best practices

React Native, Expo, TypeScript:
- Designed and implemented an interactive home screen featuring a smooth carousel animation for seamless content browsing.
- Developed a vertical reel feature, enhancing user engagement with dynamic, scrollable content.
- Built a join game functionality that allows users to quickly enter active sessions with real-time updates.
- Integrated pop-up modals for intuitive user input, improving navigation and usability.

PostgreSQL, HTTPS, UI:
- Designed and implemented a PostgreSQL database to efficiently store and retrieve user and game data.
- Integrated HTTP communication to enable seamless data exchange between the mobile app and backend services.
- Developed an interactive and dynamic grid display, allowing users to engage with real-time content updates.
- Engineered smooth user input handling, including pop-up modals and form validation, for an intuitive user experience.

Websockets, Redis:
- Designed the play screen to support real-time gameplay using WebSockets, enabling instant communication between players and the game server.
- Integrated Redis as a channel layer for efficient message delivery and real-time updates.
- Utilized Redis queues to store and deliver messages to users when offline, ensuring seamless gameplay experiences upon reconnection.
BHP is a multinational mining company, and I helped develop a platform that was used by the field workers and supervisors to automate and standardise the daily on-site mining operations.

As a Software Developer I:
- Created new frontend and backend features, such as a page dedicated to logging reports, and a versions- comparisons UI for data points.
- Optimised features to resolve performance issues and improve user experience, this often involved backend Graphene and frontend React Relay GQL query optimisation.
- Refactored code that improved the readability and reusability of particular functions, such as Django admin file uploads and error- message dependent routing.
- Participated in code reviews and actively sought feedback to produce the highest code quality possible.
- Received an award through Infosys for 'Outstanding Performance'.
At BHP I was also an active member in the Operational Support team, where we maintained the functionality of the production application and liaised with clients.

As an Operational Support member I:
- Debugged and pushed code fixes for production issues, investigating logs within the AWS infrastructure, learning the codebase, and analysing Django admin records.
- Prioritised the user experience by actively talking to them when they raised production incident tickets, this gave me an appreciation for their issues and the impact it has on their work.
- Set up meetings and coordinated the collaborative effort between Dev and Operational Support teams when working through production bugs and feature quality tests.
- Wrote documentation for the Operational Support team on best practices and debugging techniques for particular features within the platform.
Infosys is a multinational IT company and for the first three months I successfully completed training courses in C#, Java, SQL, and Angular.
I passed fortnightly exams that assessed our proficiency in the required technologies, and despite already knowing Python the strict OOP and static typing of Java and C# was interesting to learn.
Prior to Infosys, I had taught myself web development through online resources and I quickly became enamoured by Python, JavaScript, CSS, SQL and Git.

Infosys hired me after seeing a small UI project I built that pulled data from a public API (which has since been decommisioned). It's crude, it's naïve, and it's honest, gratefully I have learnt a lot since then.

I have a Bachelor (Honours) degree in Psychology, I want to help people and I find Psychology interesting, though it is not a profession I have decided to pursue. I am now passionate about technology as a way to help others.

Some of the skills I developed at university involve critical thinking, researching, academic writing and literature review, prioritising assignments, meeting deadlines, and understanding evidence-based principles for human motivation.

I was awarded a Letter of Commendation for outstanding academic performance after achieving a grade average above 80%, and wrote a dissertation on psychological well-being, which involved me recruiting and coordinating over 100 participants who volunteered for a week-long data analysis.

heading.description: My expertise lies in leveraging proven technologies to solve complex problems and deliver reliable, maintainable, and scalable solutions. Below, I highlight the key areas where I've driven impact, demonstrating how I've applied these platforms and tools to achieve meaningful results in real-world projects.

content.description: For BHP I built new features using tools including MUI, React Relay, and Formik. I also routinely made code improvements such as client-side data validation, which were often inspired by user interactions and incident tickets.
For this resume I used similar tools (React, MUI) and implemented design patterns that I learnt such as prop rendering. I have also used Typescript and written unit tests for key operations.
This resume uses Django and a Postgres DB to serve up the text content.
For BHP, I optimised key server-side functions, focusing on Django and Graphene queries within views, serializers, mutations and resolvers.
I wrote, refactored, and debugged functionality within Django's core features (views, serializers, models, admin, templates, etc).
For every piece of code I produced I wrote accompanying unit tests and also utilised fixture sets to move away from the overhead of prod dumps.
Django channels
Calm and Connected.
This resume uses Django and a Postgres DB to serve up the text content.
This resume uses Django and a Postgres DB to serve up the text content.
For BHP I optimised server-side functionality and cached tables that were read often and infrequently updated.
Bingo
Expo
Calm and Connected
Our team practiced agile methodology in which I participated in daily scrums, sprint planning, sprint retrospection, and backlog grooming on Jira tickets.
As a developer I made a regular practice of managing feature branches, rebasing, and resolving merge conflicts.
I participated in code reviews and approving pull requests, while actively taking on any feedback and advice in how to improve the quality of my code.
I followed BHP's lead and built Pre-Commit into this resumes workflow to automate and enforce quality styling standards.
I collaboratively deployed hot fixes for production following feature releases, and so I learnt the full pipeline including build stages, testing, infrastructure configuration, and deployment.
Within this project I automated unit test execution and pushed docker images to a registery, making use of the projects docker-compose container configuration.
Exploring CI/CD options and GitHub Actions showed me the many server, infrastructure and deployment options that are available for differing sized and scalable applications.

Having learnt the AWS infrastructure that BHP used for their project I decided to replicate it for this web resume. I have since moved to a Linux VPS, but I had successfully deployed to AWS and made use of its scalability features.
Successfully deploying to AWS involved using; ECR, Fargate, ECS, ALB, Security Group, VPC endpoints, Parameter Store Secrets, IAM, RDS, CloudWatch.
I have used multi-stage builds for the docker images, docker-compose for network and volume orchestration, and I am looking to implement Kubernetes for production container management.
Managing dependencies gave me greater exposure to the Linux file structure and its executables.
Leveraging package managers was cool but understanding the security and functional dynamics of dependencies was really interesting.
If you have a proposal, idea, feedback, or just want to say hi, I would love to hear from you!

heading.description: A passionate problem-solver with a background in IT and web development, I enjoy challenges and new experiences both professionally and personally. Whether it is moving to Europe, or training in Brazilian Jiu Jitsu, I love the diversity, learning, and building that comes with new adventures and journeys.

content.description: I was born in Perth, Western Australia, and for the past year I have been living in the Netherlands. At 27 years old I wanted a challenge and to experience life in a different country. I love the excitement and culture of Europe, there is always something new and dynamic to experience, and having met so many unique and amazing people I am now looking to build a life here. Although I prefer catching up with people and working from a company building, the flexibility of a remote position to become immersed in other parts of Europe is something I am particularly open to at the moment.

In my spare time you will find me at a Brazilian Jiu Jitsu gym, which is a grappling based martial art that I have been training in for the past four years. There are so many things I love about this sport, exercise, people, friends, and an infinite number of techniques and positions to learn. It is inspiring seeing myself and the people around me go from utter newbies who have no clue on what is going on to becoming adept and skilled in difficult and stressful situations such as fighting. At my local gym there is a massive quote sitting above a board of competition medals, “Surround yourself with people who make you a better person”, and I take that attitude with me everywhere I go.
